For each letter in the alphabet, apply these rules: capitalize the first letter. But if it's a vowel, then skip it. Unless it equals 7, in which case make it bold.
For each word in this sentence, apply these rules: shift by one position. But if it's divisible by 3, then use all uppercase. Unless it's the letter E, in which case add an asterisk.
For each letter in the alphabet, apply these rules: add 5. But if it's a vowel, then skip it. Unless it's the letter E, in which case repeat it twice.
For each word in this sentence, apply these rules: shift by one position. But if it has more than 5 letters, then skip it. Unless it's the letter E, in which case add an asterisk.
For numbers 1 through 10, apply these rules: add 5. But if it has more than 5 letters, then skip it. Unless it equals 7, in which case repeat it twice.
For each word in this sentence, apply these rules: capitalize the first letter. But if it's divisible by 3, then subtract 2 instead. Unless it's the letter E, in which case make it bold.
